From Your Professors: Psychology Resources â€‹

Essential Tools and Guides for Academic Success in Psychology

This curated list of resources is designed to support your research, writing, and learning in psychology. These tools have been reccomended by your professors to suit the needs of psychology students at Christ Kengeri

Writing & Citation Tools â€‹

APA Format Guide (Purdue OWL) â€‹

The Purdue Online Writing Lab (OWL) is a trusted resource for mastering APA formatting and citation rules. It provides detailed examples for references, in-text citations, and paper formatting, making it an essential tool for writing research papers and essays.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Avoid common formatting mistakes and ensure your papers meet academic standards.
  • Pro Tip: Bookmark this page for quick access during your writing process.

Scribbr Citation Generator â€‹

Scribbr is a free online tool that generates accurate citations in APA and MLA formats. It also offers additional tools like a grammar checker, paraphrasing tool, and summarizer to enhance your academic writing.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Save time on formatting references and improve the quality of your writing.
  • Pro Tip: Use the grammar checker to polish your final drafts before submission.

Grammarly Pro & Knimbus â€‹

  • Grammarly Pro: Available through Christâ€™s institutional access, Grammarly Pro offers advanced grammar, punctuation, and plagiarism checks. Itâ€™s perfect for refining your essays and research papers.
  • Knimbus: Access scholarly articles, e-books, and journals through Christ Universityâ€™s library portal.
  • Why theyâ€™re useful: Grammarly ensures error-free writing, while Knimbus provides access to a wealth of academic resources.

Research & Article Access â€‹

Sci-Hub â€‹

Sci-Hub is a platform that provides free access to paywalled research articles. Simply enter the DOI or title of the paper to download it.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Access research papers that are otherwise behind expensive paywalls.
  • Note: Use this resource ethically and responsibly.

Typeset.io â€‹

Typeset.io is an AI-powered tool that helps you discover, organize, and summarize research papers. Itâ€™s particularly useful for narrowing down relevant articles and identifying key trends in your research area.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Save time by quickly finding and understanding research papers.
  • Pro Tip: Use the summarization feature to get the gist of lengthy articles.

Shodh Ganga â€‹

Shodh Ganga is a repository of Indian theses, dissertations, and research papers. Itâ€™s an excellent resource for accessing scales, questionnaires, and studies conducted in India.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Find culturally relevant research tools and data for your projects.
  • Pro Tip: Use the advanced search feature to locate specific studies or instruments.

ResearchGate â€‹

ResearchGate is a social networking site for researchers. You can connect with authors, request full-text papers, and stay updated on the latest research in your field.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Access preprints and publications directly from researchers.
  • Pro Tip: Create a profile to showcase your work and connect with peers.

PubMed & ERIC â€‹

  • PubMed: A biomedical and psychology research database with millions of articles.
  • ERIC: A database focused on education-related psychology studies.
  • Why theyâ€™re useful: Access high-quality, peer-reviewed research articles for free.

Scopus & Web of Science â€‹

  • Scopus: A comprehensive database for tracking citations and exploring high-impact journals.
  • Web of Science: Another powerful tool for discovering influential research articles.
  • Why theyâ€™re useful: Identify key papers and track research trends in your field.

UGC CARE List â€‹

The UGC CARE list helps you verify journals approved by the University Grants Commission (UGC) for credible publications.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Ensure your research is published in reputable journals.

Learning Platforms â€‹

Coursera & Udemy â€‹

  • Coursera: Offers courses like Psychological First Aid and other psychology-related topics.
  • Udemy: Provides affordable courses, such as CBT Practitioner and SPSS Basics.
  • Why theyâ€™re useful: Learn new skills and earn certifications to enhance your resume.

MIT OpenCourseWare â€‹

Access free course materials from MIT, including psychology lectures, assignments, and readings.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Learn from one of the worldâ€™s top institutions at no cost.

EPGP Pathsaala â€‹

A UGC MOOC platform offering structured learning modules in psychology and other disciplines.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Supplement your coursework with additional learning resources.

Coding & Data Analysis â€‹

Codecademy â€‹

Learn coding basics (Python, R) for data analysis in psychology.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Gain skills in data analysis and visualization, which are increasingly important in psychology research.

SPSS Basics â€‹

SPSS (Statistical Package for the Social Sciences) is a powerful tool for statistical analysis.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Analyze data from experiments and surveys with ease.
  • Pro Tip: Look for beginner-friendly SPSS courses on Coursera or Udemy.

Guides & Books â€‹

How to Do a Literature Review â€‹

A structured guide to writing literature reviews, covering everything from topic selection to synthesis.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Master the art of reviewing and organizing existing research.

Free Psychology Books (PDF Drive) â€‹

Access free psychology textbooks and reference books for your studies.

  • Why itâ€™s useful: Save money on expensive textbooks and access a wide range of materials.

Journal Websites â€‹

  • Taylor & Francis
  • Elsevier
  • ScienceDirect
  • Why theyâ€™re useful: Access high-quality journals and stay updated on the latest research.

Explore these resources to enhance your academic journey in psychology. Happy learning!
